info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 24 at 2:48PM MDT until August 24 at 4:45PM MDT by NWS Grand Junction CO
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of southwest Colorado, including the following county, La Plata.
* WHEN...Until 445 PM MDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas south of Durango near the Animas and Florida River drainages. Overflowing poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 248 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.6 and 1.2 inches of rain have fallen with isolated areas up to 2 inches. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Salt Creek, Basin Creek,and Dry Creek - Some locations that will experience flooding include... areas south of Durango in the Animas and Florida River drainages - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON
